title: ACCC targets content, advertising in Seven West/Prime deal
text:
Seven West Media's proposed takeover of regional broadcaster Prime is in the spotlight in more than one way.

As Antony Catalano made good on his plans to try and disrupt the deal, the ACCC kicked off its informal merger review.

Seven West Media chief executive James Warburton has been interested in Prime Media since June this year. James Alcock

The competition regulator sent a letter to industry participants on Tuesday, seeking their views on the proposed $64 million scrip offer.

"The ACCC's investigation is focused on the impact on competition," the letter read.

Primarily the regulator was seeking views on how Prime and Seven's assets "compete in the supply of content to consumers and the supply of advertising services to advertisers".
description: The competition regulator has launched an informal review into Seven West Media's proposed takeover of regional broadcaster Prime.
